Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 13, mean = 26, sd = 10.92 Sample 2: n = 10, mean = 22, sd = 11.81. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 127.92. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 21 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 12 and 9 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 23 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 13 and 10 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 21 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 12 and 9 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 23 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 13 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
